original_title: Sri Lanka to provide books to school students at discount
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Minister of Education, Susil Premajayantha, said exercise books will be given at a 30 percent discount to school students.
“The State Printing Corporation has arranged for books to be provided at a 30 percent discount to students,” Premajayantha said in parliament this week.
“When I took over, it had a 800 million rupee loss but now there is a 1,250 million rupee profit, so therefore we are able to give books at a discount.”
Last year, Sri Lanka had to use an Indian credit line to print Sri Lankan text books.
Premajayantha noted the contribution of the private sector in distributing books and other essentials to school children.
“With private sector contributions, especially LOLC and Atlas, we have provided school bags, stationary and exercise books to students.” (Colombo/Jan11/2024)
